About UninstallApplication
The UninstallApplication is used to uninstall applications from WebSphere
Running UninstallApplication from commandline
Running the UninstallApplication task from the commandline is done using the following syntax (start the server first, optional parameters omitted):
mvn was5:StartServer was5:UninstallApplication \ -DwasHome=<path to websphere> \ -Dear=<name of application to uninstall>
Running UninstallApplication with definition in pom
Running the UninstallApplication task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom (start the server first, optional parameters omitted):
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>start server</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>StartServer</goal> </goals> </execution> <execution> <id>uninstall application</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>UninstallApplication</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <ear> ${artifactId}-${project.version}.ear </ear> <wasHome>C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer</wasHome> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
When running this task, WebSphere may complain, giving you a message like this:
[java] WASX7022E: Problem running command "$AdminControl invoke [$AdminApp install HostserverServiceEJB-2.1.jar] invoke [$AdminConfig save]" -- exception i nformation: com.ibm.ws.scripting.ScriptingException: WASX7025E: Error found in S tring ""; cannot create ObjectName.
This message can safely be ignored.
